data.title: MarketWatch First Take: Big Tech is now on feds’ hit list for anti-competitive tactics, but will anything really change?
data.text: The market dominating behavior of four of the biggest companies in tech may now be in the sights of the U.S. government, but the big question for consumers and investors is will anything actually change this time around?

data.title: Tech giants face new scrutiny causing stocks to recoil
data.text: Tech stocks short-circuited Monday on reports that Silicon Valley’s top companies are facing unprecedented scrutiny of their business practices by government regulators perusing anti-competitive practices. Google parent company Alphabet and Facebook both tumbled more than 6 percent, and Amazon dropped close to 5 percent on reports that the Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission are.

data.title: Facebook keeps three-yearly 'say on pay' vote, amid outside investor doubts
data.text: Facebook Inc investors will only get to vote on the pay of Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg every three years, rather than annually as most outside shareholders would prefer, according to a vote tally released by the world's largest social media company late on Monday, following its annual meeting last week.

data.title: Apple attacks Facebook by becoming the asocial network
data.text: Sharing with everyone is passé and more than a little bit scary these days. We want to send photos to friends without posting them publicly.

data.title: Apple touts privacy in web sign-on war with Facebook, Google
data.text: Apple Inc on Monday launched a "Sign In With Apple" function to rival Facebook and Google web login accounts, drawing a contrast with rivals by stressing protection of users' information.

data.title: Is this the beginning of the end for big tech as we know it?
data.text: The war on big tech. Alphabet sinks into a bear market. With CNBC's Eamon Javers and Melissa Lee, and the Fast Money traders, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly, Dan Nathan and Guy Adami.

data.title: Apple took several swipes at Google and Facebook at its biggest software event of the year
data.text: The launch of Apple's sign-in software underscores its multi-year effort to organize its marketing and engineering efforts around privacy.

data.title: Why Facebook (FB) Stock Fell Monday
data.text: A possible antitrust probe spooked investors. Here's what you should know.

data.title: Facebook is a 'top buy' on tech correction, says RBC Capital's Mahaney
data.text: "We like Facebook on this kind of correction" and antitrust issues won't affect fundamentals, Mark Mahaney of RBC Capital Markets says.

data.title: Dow Jones Futures: Stock Market Correction Intensifies On Facebook, Google, Amazon — But This Is The Worst Part
data.text: Stock futures: The market correction intensified as antitrust-probe fears hit Facebook, Google, Amazon and Apple. Worse, top software stocks from Adobe to Twilio sold off.

data.title: GOOGL, AMZN & FB Stock Fall as Antitrust Investigations Hit Silicon Valley, Again
data.text: Alphabet Inc., and Amazon.com Inc. stocks opened Monday down big, with Amazon down 3% and Google down over 6%.

data.title: Nasdaq confirms correction as Facebook, Alphabet, Amazon drag
data.text: The Nasdaq tumbled 1.6% on Monday, confirming a correction as it was dragged down by Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.com on fears the companies are the targets of U.S. government antitrust regulators.

data.title: Why Facebook, Alphabet, and Centene Slumped Today
data.text: Tech stocks generally underperformed their peers on a rough day on Wall Street.

data.title: 5 Top Stock Trades for Tuesday: FB, QQQ, GLD
data.text: Facebook, the QQQ ETF, Starbucks, the SMH ETF, and gold are our top stock trades to watch for Tuesday. Check out the charts.

data.title: Alphabet, Apple, Amazon and Facebook are in the crosshairs of the FTC and DOJ
data.text: A new deal between the Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission will see U.S. regulators divide and conquer as they expand their oversight of Apple, Alphabet, Amazon and Facebook, according to multiple reports.

data.title: The 4 FANG Stocks Are Getting Pummeled on Trade War Worries
data.text: Not even the FANG stocks are resilient to the constant tariff and trade war headlines. Here's a look at the charts of the 4 massive tech stocks.

data.title: Apple challenges Google, Facebook for web login, touts privacy
data.text: Apple Inc on Monday launched a "Sign In With Apple" function to rival Facebook and Google web login accounts, drawing a contrast with rivals by stressing protection of users' information.

data.title: Feds target four of the biggest tech companies in U.S., and their stocks are getting slammed
data.text: Google, Amazon, Facebook and Apple — worth nearly $3 trillion combined — under federal investigation, according to series of reports.

data.title: DOJ likely to be tougher tech regulator than FTC, says NYT's Ed Lee
data.text: Nancy Scola of Politico and Ed Lee of The New York Times talk tech regulation on CNBC's "The Exchange.

data.title: Wall Street tumbles as Facebook, Alphabet extend slide
data.text: U.S. stocks went back into the red on Monday after regulatory fears sent shares of internet giants Alphabet, Facebook and Amazon.com sharply lower, particularly weighing down on the tech-laden Nasdaq.

data.title: Buy Facebook and Google Stock on Antitrust-Related Weakness
data.text:
Both FB stock and GOOG stock slid in early June on escalating antitrust concerns, but such concerns are overstated and ephemeral. 
The post Buy Facebook and Google Stock on Antitrust-Related Weakness appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Facebook Falls Following Reports Of Potential FTC Probe
data.text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB)'s stock fell Monday following reports the Federal Trade Commission "will lead an antitrust investigation under an arrangement that gives the Justice Department chief oversight" of Alphabet Inc.

data.title: Nasdaq Composite index threatens to enter correction territory on Google, Facebook antitrust concerns
data.text: The Nasdaq Composite index COMP, -1.60% is on pace to close in correction territory, popularly defined as a benchmark index closing 10% below its most recent peak, which for the Nasdaq occurred on May 3, when it closed at 8,164.

data.title: Facebook: One FAANG Name To Keep An Eye On
data.text: From strictly a 40-week moving average standpoint, Facebook is the one FAANG name trading the highest above its 40-week moving average.

data.title: Facebook falls on report of possible FTC antitrust investigation
data.text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on antitrust regulators looking into Facebook and other technology companies.

data.title: The Wall Street Journal: FTC gets jurisdiction for possible Facebook antitrust probe
data.text: The Federal Trade Commission will lead any antitrust investigation into Facebook Inc.

data.title: Facebook stock falls on concern of potential FTC competition probe
data.text: Facebook Inc. shares FB, -8.67% are down more than 6% in midday trading Monday after a report from the Wall Street Journal said that the Federal Trade Commission has gained the ability to investigate whether the social-media giant has unlawfully engaged in anticompetitive practices.

data.title: FTC to examine how Facebook's practices affect competition: WSJ
data.text: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has secured the right to examine how Facebook Inc's practices affect digital competition, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.

data.title: Kara Swisher: Facebook changed the conversation on regulation
data.text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss the antitrust probe the Department of Justice has opened against Google.

data.title: Facebook introduces Avatars, its Bitmoji competitor
data.text: Ditch those generic emoji. Facebook’s new Avatars feature lets you customize a virtual lookalike of yourself for use as stickers in chat and comments.

data.title: Amazon, Facebook and Google stocks stumble as DOJ, FTC begin probing antitrust concerns
data.text: The FTC and DOJ are said to split up antitrust probes into big tech companies.
